connector.description: Exchange information in the healthcare domain using the FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) standard.

camel.source.path.apiName.name: camel.source.path.apiName
camel.source.path.apiName.description: What kind of operation to perform One of: [CAPABILITIES] [CREATE] [DELETE] [HISTORY] [LOAD_PAGE] [META] [OPERATION] [PATCH] [READ] [SEARCH] [TRANSACTION] [UPDATE] [VALIDATE]

camel.source.path.methodName.name: camel.source.path.methodName
camel.source.path.methodName.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

camel.source.endpoint.encoding.name: camel.source.endpoint.encoding
camel.source.endpoint.encoding.description: Encoding to use for all request One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.source.endpoint.fhirVersion.name: camel.source.endpoint.fhirVersion
camel.source.endpoint.fhirVersion.description: The FHIR Version to use One of: [DSTU2] [DSTU2_HL7ORG] [DSTU2_1] [DSTU3] [R4] [R5]

camel.source.endpoint.inBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.inBody
camel.source.endpoint.inBody.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

camel.source.endpoint.log.name: camel.source.endpoint.log
camel.source.endpoint.log.description: Will log every requests and responses

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.clientFactory.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientFactory
camel.source.endpoint.clientFactory.description: To use the custom client factory

camel.source.endpoint.compress.name: camel.source.endpoint.compress
camel.source.endpoint.compress.description: Compresses outgoing (POST/PUT) contents to the GZIP format

camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: How long to try and establish the initial TCP connection (in ms)

camel.source.endpoint.deferModelScanning.name: camel.source.endpoint.deferModelScanning
camel.source.endpoint.deferModelScanning.description: When this option is set, model classes will not be scanned for children until the child list for the given type is actually accessed.

camel.source.endpoint.fhirContext.name: camel.source.endpoint.fhirContext
camel.source.endpoint.fhirContext.description: FhirContext is an expensive object to create. To avoid creating multiple instances, it can be set directly.

camel.source.endpoint.sessionCookie.name: camel.source.endpoint.sessionCookie
camel.source.endpoint.sessionCookie.description: HTTP session cookie to add to every request

camel.source.endpoint.socketTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.socketTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.socketTimeout.description: How long to block for individual read/write operations (in ms)

camel.source.endpoint.summary.name: camel.source.endpoint.summary
camel.source.endpoint.summary.description: Request that the server modify the response using the _summary param One of: [COUNT] [TEXT] [DATA] [TRUE] [FALSE]

camel.source.endpoint.validationMode.name: camel.source.endpoint.validationMode
camel.source.endpoint.validationMode.description: When should Camel validate the FHIR Server's conformance statement One of: [NEVER] [ONCE]

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.source.endpoint.password.name: camel.source.endpoint.password
camel.source.endpoint.password.description: Username to use for basic authentication

camel.source.endpoint.username.name: camel.source.endpoint.username
camel.source.endpoint.username.description: Username to use for basic authentication

camel.component.fhir.encoding.name: camel.component.fhir.encoding
camel.component.fhir.encoding.description: Encoding to use for all request One of: [JSON] [XML]

camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion.name: camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion
camel.component.fhir.fhirVersion.description: The FHIR Version to use One of: [DSTU2] [DSTU2_HL7ORG] [DSTU2_1] [DSTU3] [R4] [R5]

camel.component.fhir.log.name: camel.component.fhir.log
camel.component.fhir.log.description: Will log every requests and responses

camel.component.fhir.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.fhir.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.fhir.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.fhir.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.fhir.clientFactory.name: camel.component.fhir.clientFactory
camel.component.fhir.clientFactory.description: To use the custom client factory

camel.component.fhir.compress.name: camel.component.fhir.compress
camel.component.fhir.compress.description: Compresses outgoing (POST/PUT) contents to the GZIP format

camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout.name: camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout
camel.component.fhir.connectionTimeout.description: How long to try and establish the initial TCP connection (in ms)

camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning.name: camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning
camel.component.fhir.deferModelScanning.description: When this option is set, model classes will not be scanned for children until the child list for the given type is actually accessed.

camel.component.fhir.fhirContext.name: camel.component.fhir.fhirContext
camel.component.fhir.fhirContext.description: FhirContext is an expensive object to create. To avoid creating multiple instances, it can be set directly.

camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie.name: camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie
camel.component.fhir.sessionCookie.description: HTTP session cookie to add to every request

camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout.name: camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout
camel.component.fhir.socketTimeout.description: How long to block for individual read/write operations (in ms)

camel.component.fhir.summary.name: camel.component.fhir.summary
camel.component.fhir.summary.description: Request that the server modify the response using the _summary param One of: [COUNT] [TEXT] [DATA] [TRUE] [FALSE]

camel.component.fhir.validationMode.name: camel.component.fhir.validationMode
camel.component.fhir.validationMode.description: When should Camel validate the FHIR Server's conformance statement One of: [NEVER] [ONCE]

camel.component.fhir.password.name: camel.component.fhir.password
camel.component.fhir.password.description: Username to use for basic authentication

camel.component.fhir.username.name: camel.component.fhir.username
camel.component.fhir.username.description: Username to use for basic authentication
